page.title: 01E.Horsley S. General
page.content: This area is mainly woods, farmland & commons traversed by many bridleways, public footpaths, a few narrow lanes & a major road running East/West on the N. perimeter which carries a very heavy load for which it is unsuitable. There is no river or pond. Most houses are large as this is a wealthy area but there is a small council estate & several flint cottages built by the Earls of Lovelace. There is little obvious sense of community but when threatened with an Indian curry rest_ aurant/takeaway on the shopping parade a protest was lodged & the application refused. There is no bank, doctor or dentist. The shops include post office newsagent, chemist, butcher (grocer & greengrocer recently closed), a travel agency, horse_riding accessory suppl- ier, delicatessen & health food shop, all indicating a wealthy clientele.
